zc.thread
Class RWLockReaders

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.RWLockReaders
All Implemented Interfaces:
RWLock
public class RWLockReaders
extends java.lang.Object
implements RWLock

A RWLock that gives priority to Readers.

Read access is only granted when there is no active Writers and write access is only granted when there is no active Readers and no active Writers.

On a heavily loaded system it is possible that the number of Readers never drop to zero and consequently the RWLockReaders denies access to waiting Writers.

See Also:
"Concurrency - State Models & Java Programs, chap: 7.5, page: 144", RWLockWriters

Method Detail

acquireRead

public void acquireRead()
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: RWLock
Acquire a read lock. Blocks until a read operation can be performed safely.

This call must be followed by a call to release as soon as the read operation completes.

Specified by:
acquireRead in interface RWLock
Following copied from interface: zc.thread.RWLock
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.

acquireWrite

public void acquireWrite()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Description copied from interface: RWLock
Acquire the write lock. Blocks until the write operation can be performed safely.

This call must be followed by a call to release as soon as the write operation completes.

Specified by:
acquireWrite in interface RWLock
Following copied from interface: zc.thread.RWLock
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the calling thread is interrupted while waiting.

release

public void release()
Description copied from interface: RWLock
Release the lock. You must call this method as soon as you're done reading or writing.
Specified by:
release in interface RWLock

safe_to_read

protected boolean safe_to_read()
Return true when the conditions to accept a new Reader are met.

For this implementation the conditions are:

  • There is no active Writer

Must imperatively be called from a synchronized block.

safe_to_write

protected boolean safe_to_write()
Returns true when the condition to accept a new Writer are met.

For this implementation the conditions are:

  • There is no active Writer
  • There is no active Reader

Must imperatively be called from a synchronized block.
